definitions.title: n.f.
definitions.body: juxtaposition, but only in st. c. with force a

definitions.title: prep.
definitions.body: close by, side by side with, parallel to, agreeing with, corresponding to;—st. c. [[עֻמַּת]], exc. Ec 5:15 always c. [[לְ]], sf. [[לְעֻמָּתוֹ]], once pl. cstr. [[לְעֻמּוֹת]] Ez Eze 45:7; —

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: close by, side by side with: Ex 25:27 (Ex 37:14), Ex 28:27 (Ex 39:20), Le 3:9 [[לְעֻמַּת הֻעָחֶה יְסִירֶנָּה]] shall take it away close by the backbone; esp. of what is parallel, Ez Eze 42:7 the wall alongside of the chambers; of the contiguous portions in Ezek.'s division of the land, alongside of each other, Ez Eze 45:6, Eze 45:7, Eze 48:13, Eze 48:18, Eze 48:18, Eze 48:21; of movement in parallel lines, 2Sa 16:13 Shimei was going along [[לְעֻמָּתוֹ]] parallel with him, v:2Sa 16:13, Ez Eze 1:20 [[וְהָאוֹפַנִּים יִנׇּֽשְׂאוּ]] [[לְעֻמָּתָם]], v:Eze 1:21, Eze 3:13, Eze 10:19, Eze 11:22; Eze 3:8 [[נׇתַתִּי פָנֶי ְחֲזׇקִים לְעֻמַּת]] [[פְּנֵיהֶם]] by the side of their face (which, as antagonism is implied, = against, RV), v:Eze 3:8.

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: agreeing with, corresponding to (a common result of juxtaposition), Ex 38:18 a screen five cubits high [[לעמת קלעי החחר]] agreeing with (RV answerable unto) the hangings of the court (in height), Ez Eze 40:18; prob. also 1Ch 26:16, Ne 12:24 [[מִשְׁמָר]] ´[[מִשְׁמָר ל]] ward corresponding to ward.

definitions.title: c.
definitions.body: correspondingly to, 1Ch 24:31 they also cast lots [[לְעֻמַּת אֲחֵיהֶם]] correspondingly to their brethren, v:b the head, correspondinly to his younger brother, 1Ch 26:12 to these…belonged charges correspondingly to (in common with) their brethren.

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: before a sentence (Ges:§ 155 n), 1Ch 25:8 (strangely) [[לְעֻמַּת כַּקָּטׂן כַּגׇּדוֹל]] (v. Ke) correspondingly to (the principle) of as the small so the great; Ec 5:15 [[כָּל־עֻמַּת שֶׁכָּא]] quite exactly as he came, so shall he go (but Lambert:RÉJ xxxi. 47, Rahlfs:Th. Lt. -z. 1896, 587 [[כִּלְעֻמַּת]]).
